name: Beanie Babies A-Z Quiz Series - W  | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which of these is a penguin?
questions.explanation:
Waddle.

	Waddle is an Emperor penguin.  You can tell because he has a yellow neck, just like the Emperor penguin!  Penguins are birds that cannot fly, but instead, they swim in the water! "Waddle the Penguin likes to dress upEvery night he wears his tuxWhen Waddle walks, it never failsHe always trips over his tails!"

questions.text: Which of these is known as a whale, although it is not a whale at all?
questions.explanation:
Waves.

	Waves is known as an orca whale, according to the Beanie Baby website.  However, orcas, also known as killer whales, are not whales at all.  They are actually dolphins! "Join him today on the InternetDon't be afraid to get your feet wetHe taught all the Beanies how to surfOur web page is his home turf!"

questions.text: Which of these is a monkey?
questions.explanation:
Weaver.

	Weaver is a brown fuzzy monkey with light brown feet and a light brown face.  He also has light brown ears. "In the jungle above the groundThat's where I like to hang aroundThere's so much that I can seeFrom high up in my favorite tree!"

questions.text: Which of these is a spider?
questions.explanation:
Web.

	Web is a black widow.  He is mostly black, even his eyes, but he has a completely red underbelly, just like a black widow does.  Web is retired, and does not have a poem.

questions.text: Which of these is a dog?
questions.explanation:
Weenie.

	Weenie is a dachshund.  Dachshunds are known as weiner dogs, and the hot dog was named after this breed.  They are very small and long. "Weenie the dog is quite a sightLong of body and short of heightHe perches himself high on a logAnd considers himself to be top dog!"

questions.text: Which of these will grow up to be a doe?
questions.explanation:
Whisper.

	Whisper is a deer.  She still has her spots, which means she is a fawn.  Female deer are known as does when they grow up, so Whisper will be a doe, not a buck! "She's very shy as you can seeWhen she hides behind a treeWith big brown eyes and soft to touchThis little fawn will love you so much!"

questions.text: Which of these is a dog?
questions.explanation:
Wrinkles.

	Wrinkles the dog is a light brown dog with a white face and belly.  He is very wrinkly, thus giving him the name Wrinkles! "This little dog is named WrinklesHis nose is soft and often crinklesLikes to climb up on your lapHe's a cheery sort of chap!"

questions.text: Which of these is a panda bear?
questions.explanation:
Wonton.

	Wonton is a very fuzzy and soft panda bear.  He has a white face and belly, but the rest is black.  He lives in China, and only eats bamboo!  Bamboo may look like a tree, but it really is a grass. "In the mountains; up so highWhere you feel you can touch the skyIn the shade of a bamboo treeThis is where I am meant to be!"

questions.text: Which of these is an octopus?
questions.explanation:
Wiggly.

	Wiggly is a red octopus.  He has eight arms, which is what gives the octopus its name!  Wilbur is a pig, William is a bear, and Wish is a starfish. "Under the sea I travel with easeI flip and flop - do whatever I pleaseBeing a squid can be lots of funBecause I swim faster than anyone!"

questions.text: Which of these is a rabbit?
questions.explanation:
Winksy.

	Winksy is a bunny, or a baby rabbit.  She is related to her sisters, Binksy and Minksy. "Hopping down the bunny trailWith my little cotton tailBinksy and Minksy by my sideLet's stop and play! You seek; I'll hide!"
